intro: Eriogonum racemosum var. orthocladon, commonly known as the Sierra buckwheat, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Polygonaceae family and is characterized by its clustered, small white to pinkish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes. Its leaves are alternate and often have a rough, textured surface. It plays an important role in supporting local pollinators and is adapted to thrive in arid environments.
